intro: Elaterium amazonicum, commonly known as the Amazonian elaterium, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Lecanodermataceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Elaterium amazonicum is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
